application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
G164: Field Maple - Crown lift to 3m. Prune to clear substation by 2m. T89
T166: Ash - Monolith down to approximately 6m from ground level. T90
T194: Lime - Prune to clear rowan by 2m. T64
T320: Yew - Prune back from building by 3m. T4
T321: Pin Oak - Crown reduce by 2-3m. T5
T331: Oak - Reduce height down to approximately 12m and reduce side branching back to 2m from stem. T11
T350: Lime - Repollard. G2
All on TPO 736
decision_conditions: T166: Ash - Monolith down to approximately 6m from ground level. T90
T321: Pin Oak - Crown reduce by 2-3m. T5
T331: Oak - Reduce height down to approximately 12m and reduce side branching back to 2m from stem. T11
G164: Field Maple - Crown lift to 3m. Prune to clear substation by 2m. T89
T194: Lime - Prune to clear rowan by 2m. T64
T320: Yew - Prune back from building by 3m. T4
There are a number of mature trees in an area that can be seen by road and footpath users as well as surrounding properties. They vary in condition but are collectively a high amenity to the area.

Having looked at the trees and reasoning, there are some minor works to enable trees to coexist with property and some heavier work that seems unreasonable without more explanation and evidence provided. The more excessive works will lower the amenity that these trees provide.
This application will be a split decision as certain smaller works are acceptable while other more excessive work is not.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
